column1: #Text=Cre – LoxP technology has been utilized extensively for conditional knockouts in yeast , plants , cultured mammalian cells , T cells , neuronal tissue and so forth .

#Text=Conditional knockout mice using this technology are constructed by breeding a floxed ( i.e. , flanked by LoxP ) gene of interest with mice expressing Cre-recombinase driven by a tissue or cell-type specific promoter .

#Text=Some examples include the construction of CD4 positive cell knockouts of Irf4 by breeding Cd4 Cre mice with those containing floxed Irf4 sites ; breeding dendritic cell driven CD11c Cre mice with floxed TGFRβ II and the construction of neuronal tissue knockouts of Rem2 by breeding Rgs9 Cre with Rem2 LoxP/LoxP mice .
#Text=Although the Cre-Lox conditional knockout method is an ideal tool for the study of a gene of interest in a specific cell type , some limitations exist .
#Text=One limitation is the non-specific expression of the targeted gene resulting in off-target recombination in other cell types .
#Text=Another limitation is the potential for germline recombination of conditional alleles due to the transient Cre expression in the germline .
#Text=Thus , a careful characterization of mice generated with this system is an absolute requirement to confirm proper control of conditional recombination .
#Text=Treg cells have been recognized to be crucial in immune tolerance and the prevention of autoimmune responses .
#Text=Foxp3 YFP-Cre ( or Foxp3 Cre ) mice were constructed by Rubtsov et al. to study genes related to regulatory T ( Treg ) cell biology .
#Text=In the Foxp3 YFP-Cre mouse , the Cre gene is located after an internal ribosome entry site ( IRES ) sequence which is inserted just after the normal termination codon of Foxp3 .
#Text=This mouse was used by several groups to study the function of genes such as Uqcrsf1 , Id2 , Foxp1 , Maf in Treg cells .
#Text=However , Rubtsov et al. and Franckaert et al. have reported the off-target recombination in some hematopoietic lineage cells of a Foxp3 YFP-Cre mouse .
#Text=The authors have found that the DBC1 is involved in regulatory T-cell function under conditions of inflammation .
#Text=To study the specific function of Dbc1 in regulatory T-cells , Foxp3 YFP-Cre mice were crossed with floxed Dbc1 mice to gain the regulatory T-cell knockouts of Dbc1 .

#Text=During the breeding process , it was unexpectedly found that the floxed Dbc1 allele in some mice was totally deleted and the off-target recombination of floxed Dbc1 allele occurred in tissues other than T cells .
